DataElement.preferredName: Person Hypersensitivity Skin Prick Test Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized._A test for sensitivity to allergens. A solution containing a suspected allergy-causing substance is placed on the skin and then the skin is pricked or scratched to allow the allergen to enter the skin. If the skin develops a red, raised wheal it ususally means that the person is allergic to that allergen._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

A solution containing a suspected allergy-causing substance is placed on the skin and then the skin is pricked or scratched to allow the allergen to enter the skin.  If the skin develops a red, raised wheal it ususally means that the person is allergic to that allergen.

Property.preferredDefinition: A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:A test for sensitivity to allergens.  A solution containing a suspected allergy-causing substance is placed on the skin and then the skin is pricked or scratched to allow the allergen to enter the skin.  If the skin develops a red, raised wheal it ususally means that the person is allergic to that allergen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

A test for sensitivity to allergens. A solution containing a suspected allergy-causing substance is placed on the skin and then the skin is pricked or scratched to allow the allergen to enter the skin. If the skin develops a red, raised wheal it usually means that the person is allergic to that allergen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Allergy skin prick testing is
ReferenceDocuments.description: Allergy skin prick testing is a method to diagnose allergies by provoking a small, controlled allergic response.

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
